intro: Seaforthia patula, commonly known as the slender seaforthia, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue or violet in color, arranged in whorled clusters along the stem. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in dune environments, where it plays a role in stabilizing coastal sands. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists studying coastal flora.
